main.name: Steve Mullins
main.description: Hello, my name is Steve. I am a project manager specializing in technical fields such as Space Science, Software, Chemistry and Environmental Science who is currently looking for a position in a company as a Software Developer
main.bio: I am a self-taught programming student focusing primarily on Javascript and nodeJS with other bits of technology sprinkled in here and there. Before my plunge into coding I was working on NASA's Cassini Mission to Saturn, a very exciting job that introduced me to many Sys. Admins and Software Engineers who inspired me to pursue a career in Software Development. When I am not studying I am usually climbing, fishing, cooking or fixing broken cars/motorcycles.
main.contactmessage: Have any questions? Want to collaborate on a project? Feel free to contact me!

resume.skillmessage: Some of the skills I have picked up during previous employment

education.description: Core curriculum for Pre-Pharmacy/Neuroscience program. General study of Biology, Physics, Math, Chemistry, and my favorite, Organic Chemistry. Though I didn't know it at the time, Organic Chemistry involves a very similar skill set as software engineering. Many different problems to solve and many different ways to solve the problems.

education.school: Udemy, Harvard EDX, Linux Foundation and more
education.degree: C.S., Javascript, NodeJS, Full Stack Web Development
education.description: Around early 2017 while working side by side with many other software engineers, I decided to start a self study of programming. I began with the Harvard EDX CS50 class. After that class I knew I wanted to pursue software engineering. I learned what I could from co-workers and upon mission end I started taking online courses through Udemy and completing personal projects. I continue to take courses daily in hopes of improving my skills as a software developer.

work.title: Deputy Director Cassini Imaging Team (ISSOPS)
work.description: An exciting position working on one of NASA's most successful and longest running missions. I was in charge of processing images for web releases, coordinating web projects between JPL and ISSOPS and a project manager for the imaging team, managing up to 10 scientists and software engineers who were developing mission critical software/databases and pointing designs for the spacecraft. In this position I became familiar with Linux cmd line navigation, server maintenance and setup, Javascript, PHP, MySQL navigation, HTML/CSS and IDL.

work.title: Chemistry Supervisor
work.description: Supervised 18+ employees in one of the world's busiest WADA-accredited laboratories. Learned how to manage people more effectively and how work within a large ecosystem consisting of many departments and many different procedures. Lived in a big city, far away from mountains and learned not to live in a big city, far away from mountains.

projects.title: Gear Swap
projects.category: A Craigslist style site where users can sell used outdoor gear. My first medium sized nodeJS app that features userAuth, image storage, heroku deployment and location.

projects.title: HomeMade
projects.category: Food Delivery type app. Still a work in progress. Using Graphql Apollo on the backend, React and ApolloProvider on the frontend

projects.title: Food Chat
projects.category: Work in progress. Another exploration with GraphQL and realtime subscriptions. Will be converted into a mobile feature for HomeMade app.

projects.title: Funky fun with React and APIs
projects.category: Exploring API calls and rendering images in carousel style in React. Stepping stone towards a bigger idea.

projects.title: Favorite Food Site
projects.category: Another step towards a bigger idea. Learning React a bit more. Rendering shopping carts and items depending on state.

projects.title: WorkIn
projects.category: My current side project. Fullstack app where users can share remote working locations and comment on features. NodeJS/express/cloudinary/multer, will later use React/googleMaps

projects.title: WolfGang Bio
projects.category: This project is from a job interview challenge. Given a timeline I was to create a bio page using only HTML/CSS. The main challenge was to create a visual appealing and engaging site without the use of Javascript.

projects.title: Family Blog
projects.category: Website I built for my family travels. I used a CMS as making quick updates from anywhere in the world on any device and internet connection is a breeze.
